questions.question: Mainland Greece is a peninsula, which is

choices.answer: a narrow waterway joining two larger bodies of water
land that is completely surrounded by water
land that is surrounded by water on three sides
a narrow strip of land with sea on either side

questions.question: Why were the villages and farms in ancient Greece isolated from each other?

choices.answer: They were separated by walls.
They were separated by different languages.
They were separated by mountains and the sea.
They were separated by deserts.

questions.question: Why did people in different Greek settlements have very little communication with each other?

choices.answer: They were always at war and didn't try to communicate.
They didn't know other people existed.
The land was difficult to travel.

questions.question: Most ancient Greek people made a living by

choices.answer: farming
going to war
being politicians

questions.question: One reason it was difficult to farm in ancient Greece is because the land was

choices.answer: very expensive
very wet all of the time
frozen for ten months of the year
very rocky everywhere

questions.question: How did some ancient Greek farmers deal with their land's limitations?

choices.answer: They went to war to find more land suitable for farming.
They often had to steal from their neighbor's farms.
They built earth steps into the hills to create flat land.

questions.question: One way ancient Greeks often prepared for forming colonies was by

choices.answer: consulting an oracle to speak to the Greek gods
rolling dice to see if they should travel or not
bathing their oxen in order to cleanse their animals

questions.question: People of ancient Greece's mainland often traded for goods such as

choices.answer: olives & grapes
grain, timber, and metal
spices & pottery
gold & silver

questions.question: Which of the following was a challenge of traveling by sea for ancient Greeks?

choices.answer: Finding oracles who would allow them to travel by sea.
Many Greek men were afraid to travel by ship.
Many Greek women wouldn't let their husbands travel by sea.
They had no compasses or charts to help them navigate.

questions.question: Ancient Greeks could not feed their increasing population, so they began forming ____ overseas.

choices.answer: armies
prayer groups
colonies
